content:
Hello Everyone,
For the last few weeks, I have not been getting the nice "Goals Accomplished :tada: " message after finishing lean4 proofs on vscode. In the past, this was a helpful sign that the proof was indeed complete, but now (especially when there are many errors), I have to check the "by" line for red squiggly error lines to make sure the proof is actually done. Is there a reason this "Goals Accomplished" message doesn't exist?
Look around in #lean4 or #mathlib4. This was already discussed at length.
The "Error Lens" extension is also very useful for spotting errors. I recommend it.

Found this long thread: https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/premature.20.22goals.20accomplished.22
@Jireh Loreaux thanks for the suggestion, it is brilliant

On a different note, after reading that thread: I hope that the knowers that be, don't decide to bring back or enforce the old pascal/ada style begin..end and line separators. The current indentation based syntax is much easier on the eye.
Shreyas Srinivas has marked this topic as resolved.
